text: Suggestion for custom modules: For Display Conditions, we have ‘is empty’, ‘is not empty’ and ‘is equal to’. Can we have ‘is not equal to’? This would help with some logic requirements I have.
I would also love to see the ability to input multiple possibilities for ‘is equal to’ (i.e. is equal to ‘type1’ or ‘type2’), but I understand if that one doesn’t have a great deal of application.
Second this! I've used RegEx to achieve the "not equal to" condition in some cases, but it's such a hassle compared to just selecting an option from the dropdown.

I agree with this.

A bonus suggestion on top of this would be to have a HubSpot predefined list of common regex queries for each instance that you guys give us a regex field

For example “valid css class names”
“Valid date formats”
Maybe though I just want that because I’m a newb with regex
Are you saying you can use RegEx to affect the custom module options’ display conditions? If we can do that, I’d be okay just using RegEx (but I too am a newb with it).

Yup that’s what I do, Jeff. You have to be careful with it so it doesn’t get messy, but it works. And I use the {{ name }} parameter to differentiate between multiple entries of the same module so the custom options of one doesn’t overwrite to the others.

I don’t want to upgrade the module, i want to make a new one and just copy some text from it … copy to clipboard is disabled … it shouldn’t be and i don’t want to upgrade just to copy some of the code
Looks like HubSpot is wrapping a div around my input … trying to build an accordion and this prevents functionality … regardless … extra code should not be added

When adding a form to a page there should be an option to use the form’s default confirmation. <https://spin.d.pr/6VTem4+>
<https://spin.d.pr/obYcp1+>
<@U2PDTMH53> Yikes never seen that before with the div around the input, <@U22PJPGK0> any ideas of what might be going on there?
The Add Field section can definitely be taller ... so no scroll needed

Suggestion: when adding a choice field to a custom module, make default value when adding choice options be a lowercase hyphen or underscore separated version of the label. Just like the field name and variable name work.

While that may not always be what someone wants, it’s a good starting point - 80% of the time that’s what I end up doing with it anyways.
Random question: anyone know does the Password Prompt module actually do anything on a normal(non system) page?
